column1: Many Eclipse perspectives
column2: e g  the Java Development Tools

column1: Allinea DDT _ a graphical debugger supporting for parallel multi_process and multithreaded applications
DDD is the standard front_end from the GNU Project  It is a complex tool that works with most common debuggers natively or with some external programs

GDB GUI Emacs   Emacs editor with built_in support for the GNU Debugger acts as the frontend  KDbg   Part of the KDE development tools  Nemiver   A GDB frontend that integrates well in the GNOME desktop environment  xxgdb   X_window frontend for GDB and dbx debugger  Qt Creator   multi_platform frontend for GDB
column2: CDB and LLDB  Allinea s DDT   a parallel and distributed front_end to a modified version of GDB  Xcode   contains a GDB front_end as well  SlickEdit   contains a GDB front_end as well  Eclipse C C   Development Tools  2    includes visual debugging tools based on GDB  CodeLite   An open source
column3: cross platform C C   IDE which have front end for gdb
column4: the next version of CodeLite will also include a front end to the LLDB CodeBlocks   A free cross_platform C
column5: C   and Fortran IDE with a front end for gdb  RR   An open source C C   debugger by Mozilla
column6: supporting reproduction of program state and reverse execution

column1: Emacs   Emacs editor with built_in support for the GNU Debugger acts as the frontend
KDbg   Part of the KDE development tools
Nemiver   A GDB frontend that integrates well in the GNOME desktop environment
xxgdb   X_window frontend for GDB and dbx debugger
Qt Creator   multi_platform frontend for GDB
Allinea s DDT   a parallel and distributed front_end to a modified version of GDB
Xcode   contains a GDB front_end as well
SlickEdit   contains a GDB front_end as well
Eclipse C C   Development Tools  2    includes visual debugging tools based on GDB
CodeLite   An open source
column2: cross platform C C   IDE which have front end for gdb
column3: the next version of CodeLite will also include a front end to the LLDB

column1: CodeBlocks   A free cross_platform C
column2: C   and Fortran IDE with a front end for gdb

column1: RR   An open source C C   debugger by Mozilla
column2: supporting reproduction of program state and reverse execution

column1: Inspection of variable values in a tree structure
Direct member  For certain compound data types the most important member values are displayed next to the variable name
column2: so that it is not necessary to expand the subtree of that variable in order to see the member value  For example
column3: you don t need to go into a variable of type QString if you want to see the string that the variable holds  KDbg can even display Qt s QString values

column1: Debugger at your finger tips  The basic debugger functions are bound to function keys F5 through F10  Quick and easy
Of course
column2: lots of other basic functions  View source code
column4: set program arguments and environment variables
column5: display arbitrary expressions  Everything you need to debug a program
